section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 21. Factors Influencing Health Status > c. Categories of Z Codes > 3) Status

content.full_text: See Section I.B.14. for underimmunization documentation by clinicians other than the patient's provider. (Evidence: pg no: 94, L45)
content.summary: Z28.3 for underimmunization status with reference to documentation requirements in Section I.B.14 (Evidence: pg no: 94, L44-L45)
key_concepts: Documentation by other clinicians (Evidence: pg no: 94, L45)
Cross-reference to Section I.B.14 (Evidence: pg no: 94, L45)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Refer to Section I.B.14 for documentation by clinicians other than patient's provider (Evidence: pg no: 94, L45)
detailed_rules.explanation: Special documentation requirements apply when underimmunization is documented by clinicians other than the patient's primary provider (Evidence: pg no: 94, L45)

workflow_steps: Step 2: Check who documented the status
Step 3: Apply Section I.B.14 requirements if applicable

specific_codes.context: Use when patient has incomplete immunization status

references_to.title: Documentation by clinicians other than patient's provider
references_to.explanation: Provides specific documentation requirements for underimmunization status

coding_scenarios.documentation_example: 6-month-old infant behind on routine immunizations. Missing DTaP and Hib vaccines per CDC schedule.
step_by_step: Step 3: Apply Section I.B.14 if needed

correct_coding.rationale: Patient has incomplete immunization status (Evidence: pg no: 94, L44)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Z23 is for actual immunization encounters, not status
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Confusing immunization encounter with status codes

warnings: Must follow Section I.B.14 documentation requirements (Evidence: pg no: 94, L45)
tips: Remember to check Section I.B.14 for documentation rules
